Improvements.Change_Diff:

+ sb.append(LS).append("### Quantiles ").append(skName).append(" DATA DETAIL: ").append(LS);
Improvements.Description: In Java, string concatenation inside a loop is a performance hit. It is better to use StringBuilder's append method to append the string.

Improvements.Improvement: Use enhanced for loop instead of traditional for loop
Improvements.Change_Diff:
- for (int i=0; i < bbCount; i++) {
+ for (double value : combBuf) {
Improvements.Description: Instead of using a traditional for loop to iterate over `combBuf`, use an enhanced for loop. This makes the code more readable and less prone to off-by-one errors.
Magic numbers are numbers that occur multiple time in the code without clear meaning. They should be replaced by named constants.
